instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance – this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..

threads.title: MAcbookPro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image no chim
threads.message:
Hi 
I have a MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with liquid damage. I tried by cleaning and replacing some damaged or rusted components and finely it start taking 120-150mAmp but no image and no chim. Then i got to know that <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL> and PWM2 are not present on <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> & <CHIP>U7420</CHIP>.
Then i check <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> which looks good and also i removed it and soldered back but still nothing happens. What else i need to do?

threads.title: MAcbookPro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image no chim
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> only appears under heavy graphics load.
What about <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and voltage on other big coils?

<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: MAcbookPro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image no chim
threads.message:
Thanks for your quick reply
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> was short with pin 41 <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_CPUVR_VIN</SIGNAL> so i replaced that i am getting <SIGNAL>CPUCORE_FCCM</SIGNAL>-2V but no response at other points. i don't have list of power rail in the schematics. i checked randomly these power rail.
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>---0.9V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>--0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>--0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_CPU_R</SIGNAL>--0V
PPVCCEDRAM_S0CPU--0V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> is Low
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>--1.2V

threads.title: MAcbookPro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image no chim
threads.message:
As I said, forget about  <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>.
But <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> must appear before <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>.

Post exact ohm value to L7702, L7210/20/70.
Compare with other board, if possible.
